basics.name: Andrew Cooper
basics.label: Data Enthusiast
basics.summary: I am a highly motivated and self-driven individual with experience developing Business Intelligence and software solutions. My experience is spread across a wide range of industries including financial services, insurance, retail, and SaaS. I am eager to continue developing creative and comprehensive solutions in addition to leveraging my strong back-end development skills in a role that challenges me to continuously expand my technical knowledge base.

highlights: Built ETL flows to support internal and client facing data needs.
Gathered, summarized and presented client requirements to developers for project kick-offs.
Researched and implemented open source technologies to support internal needs.
Developed and maintained client reporting solutions.

Developed new features, supported existing features, and maintained four separate application databases ranging from insurance claim processing applications with 200,000 claims per day of throughput to a point-of-sale transactional system processing over $150 million per year in credit card and check transactions
Led back-end design and architecture of all new features being implemented into current production systems
Served as the liaison between the development team and the business-side regarding data-centric issues within the production applications
Investigated, planned, and designed data warehouse solutions for various clients with heavy interaction across multiple departments
Developed, implemented, and supported data warehouses for clients using T-SQL and SSIS
Performed query tuning maintenance to reduce load on servers
Leveraged BIML to address the issue of producing timely SSIS solutions against changing schemas

One of 20 supervisors that supported, organized, and dispatched 150 consultants over the Indiana University campus Mentored 3 consultants per semester via one-on-one weekly meetings, overseeing their personal and professional development Created a merit based reward system that both motivated consultants and allowed them to track their professional progress
Mentored 3 consultants per semester via one-on-one weekly meetings, overseeing their personal and professional development
Created a merit based reward system that both motivated consultants and allowed them to track their professional progress
